mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Reports that the Marquis de Lafayette was "handsomely" received in Virginia during his stay there; just prior to his visit Jefferson recovered from an illness in which his jaw was swollen shut for three weeks.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Lafayette, Marie Joseph Paul Yves Roch Gilbert Du Motier, marquis de, 1757-1834
Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1824 November 9, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to [William Short], n.p.
